byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: TALAVERA DE LA REINA, Spain, Sept. 22 (By Telephone to Lisbon, Portugal). -- General Francisco Franco's Foreign Legion and Moors were sweeping southeast tonight toward relief of the besieged cadets in the Toledo Alcazar after smashing the backbone of...
docs.lead_paragraph: TALAVERA DE LA REINA, Spain, Sept. 22 (By Telephone to Lisbon, Portugal). -- General Francisco Franco's Foreign Legion and Moors were sweeping southeast tonight toward relief of the besieged cadets in the Toledo Alcazar after smashing the backbone of the Leftist forces and cutting Madrid's communications with the south.

headline.main: INSURGENTS SWEEP ON TOWARD TOLEDO; PLANES CLEAR WAY; Torrijos, Last Outpost Town, Taken in March -- Madrid Rushes Re-enforcements. ALL MEN CALLED TO HELP Government Forces Prepare to Defend Toledo as the Alcazar Still Holds Out. REBELS ALSO PUSH NORTH 10,000 Reported Slain in Red Terror -- Uruguay Breaks Off Relations With Madrid. Rebel Columns Drive Forward INSURGENTS SWEEP ON TOWARD TOLEDO

byline.original: By FRANK L. KLUCKHOHNWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 22. -- The Uruguayan Government severed diplomatic relations with Spain this afternoon on the ground that the Madrid Government was no longer able to guarantee the lives or property of foreigners.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 22. -- The Uruguayan Government severed diplomatic relations with Spain this afternoon on the ground that the Madrid Government was no longer able to guarantee the lives or property of foreigners.
docs.abstract: Killed by Spanish militiamen in Madrid despite wearing of Uruguayan natl colors; Uruguay severs diplomatic relations with Spain

headline.main: URUGUAY SEVERS TIES WITH SPAIN; Ends All Diplomatic Relations After Three Sisters of Vice Consul in Madrid Are Shot. BODIES FOUND IN MORGUE Decree Holds Foreigners' Lives Are No Longer Safe -- Rebels Get Sympathy From Brazil.

headline.main: URUGUAY GETS APOLOGY; Madrid Promises Action In Killings That Broke Diplomatic Ties.

docs.snippet: Last week's foreign exchange market labored under the imminence of a devaluation in the French franc, which, when announced on Saturday, unsettled trading here and brought to a complete stop operations abroad.

headline.main: FOUR REBELS EXECUTED; A Fifth, Judge During Primo de Rivera Dictatorship, Doomed.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 1. -- The Spanish motorship Cabo San Antonio, which has been barred from Brazilian and Uruguayan ports in the past several days, was anchored tonight in the Plate River forty-five miles below Buenos Aires with two...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 1. -- The Spanish motorship Cabo San Antonio, which has been barred from Brazilian and Uruguayan ports in the past several days, was anchored tonight in the Plate River forty-five miles below Buenos Aires with two Argentine cruisers standing by.
docs.abstract: Vessel, run by crew, barred from South Amer ports; anchors in Plate River, watched by Argentine cruisers; Spanish Govt to decide on action

headline.main: ARGENTINE CRUISERS WATCH SPANISH SHIP; 2 War Craft Stand by Vessel Run by Crew and Barred From Other Countries.

docs.snippet: Business in the foreign exchange market last week was subject to severe irregularity in anticipation of devaluation in the French franc, and the Netherlands and Swiss currencies.
